page.title: 11Wilmington Priory
page.content:
Wilmington Priory dates back to Norman times. It is owned by the Sussex Archaeological Society and includes an excellent agricultural museum.
Much of the Priory is in ruins but it is easy to see where the walls of the building were. The South wall of the 14th Century Hall is still standing and shows what an impressive building this was. You can still see the well and go down into the Medieval Crypt.
Exhibits in the agricultural museum include a vast array of 18th and 19th Century farm implements, mainly from Sussex. In the Tudor kitchen there are exhibits of kitchen implements while in the porch are larger pieces of agricultural machinery.
